required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of NPPA/NPPB Haplotype on Natriuretic Peptide Plasma Levels
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of NPPA/NPPB Haplotype on Natriuretic Peptide Plasma Levels

brief_summary.textblock: Crosssectional study to analyse the genetic influence on levels of cardiac biomarkers (BNP, NT-proBNP).

detailed_description.textblock:
Background
Natriuretic peptides play an important role in risk stratification and management of patients undergoing non-cardiac surgery. However, due to genetic variability, the levels of these biomarkers may differ in individual patients with cardiac derangement. In the preoperative setting, genetic contribution to natriuretic peptide plasma level variability has not yet been determined.
Objective
The aim of this study is to assess genetic contribution to NP plasma level variability in a Swiss cohort.
Methods
Cross-sectional association study in a cohort of non-cardiac surgery patients.
This study is a Subproject of a prospective cohort study registered under the ID 041/09.

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of NPPA/NPPB haplotype on natriuretic peptide plasma levels
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples collected at start of anesthetic procedure
primary_outcome.description: Estimation of genetic effects on natriuretic peptide (BNP, NT-proBNP) plasma levels

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing elective surgery with anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years and older
- Written informed consent
- Scheduled surgery
Exclusion Criteria
- No informed consent
- Cognitive impairment

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anaesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Inselspital, University of Bern
